Topic.Title: I like Amazon.. but

Message.Msg: Yes, each comes with a 1 MP camera. Nexus 7 has built-in GPS chip. Not sure about a GPS chip on Fire HD. Perhaps the most compelling reason to go with Nexus 7 is the 7.5 hours battery life thanks to the more efficient LED display. Remember that Nexus 7 is built by a top PC vendor, Asus.

Topic.Title: Fire HD vs Nexus 7

Message.Msg: Yes, GPS is quote important for a 7" portable device. Fire HD is 17mm wide than Nexus 7, which make it less portable. More difficult to put into the pocket.

Topic.Title: $260 tomorrow...

Message.Msg: Except that the "best profit maker in America" part has not nor will ever happen. Amazon owning commerce will never happen. The USPS, Fedex, UPS will belong to AMZN or go bankrupt in such scenario. Paying 10% tax will give the advantage to smaller retailer with out-of-state presence.

Topic.Title: Fire HD vs Nexus 7

Message.Msg: $199 Fire HD: HDMI port. $199 Nexus 7: none. Fire HD: 16GB. Nexus 7: 8GB. Don't get me wrong, the Nexus is a nice unit. However, no HDMI is a deal breaker.

Topic.Title: Whats Going on AMZN? Some BIZZARE Volume..

Message.Msg: Need to post more

Message.Title: P/E. 315......unreal...and the analysts are not
Message.Msg: Downgrading?...????????????

Message.Title: Tempting to short
Message.Msg: Not going to say if I have for sure, but earlier I was tempted to short the stock here, and I rarely have the guts to short anything. I love Amazon and shop online there more than even Walmart, but that could easily change if my state starts forcing Amzn to withhold state tax. And I hear that is happening very soon with California, and they say, so how Cali goes, goes the rest of the country. Also, how can Amzn possibly give away and sustain the Kindle tablet low wireless subscription rate. I guess it is a $50 special for a year, but it seems like a crooked way to get customers, when it has to be tough for other large carriers to do the same, but may have to. I am not a tablet person anyway, and own 2 laptops, so maybe I am not the expert to ask, but anyway. Finally, Amazon is the best customer service store online out there, but I seriously think margins will get squeezed alot more and net income is not so great. It may not happen by Christmas, but I bet the shorts will grow in numbers as Amzn becomes less stellar, and maybe end up disappointing....imo.

Topic.Title: P/E. 315......unreal...and the analysts are not

Message.Msg: Not yet. They won't downgrade until the fall BEGINS. Then the downgrades come. Analysts are always behind the price action. Fair price on amazon assumes in 2014 or 2015 they might hit $3/share in EPS. Put a 20 PE on that which is greater than faster growing and more profitable apple's PE and you get 60/share in 2015. Should they not hit that EPS maybe lower and based on their probably multi-decade investement plans they may not hit it for 5 or 10 years. The stock will have a dramatic fall from grace at some point. I sold cuz I don't want to be in it when it does happen. At that point even buyers in the 100's are going to get scorched. Amazon is great, I use their services for buying and for hosting but every business has a price and amazon is perhaps priced 10 years or more where it should be.

Topic.Title: Sybil...the Ultimate Idiot and Contrarian Indicator

Message.Msg: Sybs: These scams work until they don't... The squeeze is everywhere right now. Anyone who thinks the moves here (and elsewhere) represent a healthy and stable market needs to go to a mental ward... Staying true to my plan. Been a tough week, but I'm doing just fine. When the longs get squeezed rather than the shorts, it's gonna be fun. Right now, the big longs and big shorts are just playing with retail shorts... Pretty soon, they are gonna play with retail longs... Oh, and I am serious about AAPL suing AMZN soon. I have no doubt that AAPL will find a piece of IP that AMZN is infringing. Hell, maybe GOOG/MMI will sue AMZN. That would be priceless... Unlike the other two, AMZN doesn't have the cash to fight that battle... I wonder how much working capital is has tied up in the Kindle platform in advance of the launch and for holiday season sales?

Message.Title: Amazon is in a warehousing business
Message.Msg: Margins will go down further as they don't have a lot of pricing power if they try to raise rates in Amazon fulfillment centers. Shipping costs are also going up and AMZN is absorbing them. For this reason they need to open more warehouses and hire a lot more workers, so fixed costs are going way up. I wanted to do Amazon FBA for my business, but it turned out to be not such a great deal as you can't pick a location. Listing fees are ok, but I try to avoid it as much as I can. There are better ways to advertise and retain 8% savings.

Message.Title: Kindle Fire HD Wireless is not FCC approve yet !
Message.Msg: I "guess" that Amazon knew they should not announce a new product before FCC approval, but they also knew that they must announce it before Apple announce their new products. Why? If Amazon announces their new product after Apple, the "wow" effect will be gone. It is true that Amazon can sell table for no profit and very cheap, but everyone knows that no one can make a better tablet than Apple !! This is also why Google, Motorola, Nokia and more announced their product just before Apple !! You need to watch out these stock price on 9/12, when Apple comes out with better and more profitable tablet and iphone. I will get some AMZN shares when it drops back below $220 or less.

Topic.Title: Kindle Fire HD Wireless is not FCC approve yet !

Message.Msg: The article said AMZN does not have experience in making electronic products. AT&T declines comments. Until it approves, they can accept pre-orders but there are risks involved. Very unusual that AMZN would do this. Very strange practice.

Topic.Title: Kindle Fire HD Wireless is not FCC approve yet !

Message.Msg: Classic example of a wannabe company that does not have a deep pool of engineers to bring product from development to mass production. The left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. Very inefficient model that will always result in buggy product. The life cycle of these high tech toys in under one year. Therefore, one only has one chance to get it right before full fledge production. I predict that Scamazon will exit the tablet business within 18 months.

Topic.Title: Kindle Fire HD Wireless is not FCC approve yet !

Message.Msg: Amazon thinks it owns the regulators after the eBooks ripoff (a monopolist lobbies DOJ to go after AAPL) and the MSFA lobbying campaign (spending millions to ensure smaller retailers do not get the same edge on Amazon that it had on bricks and mortar). AMZN figures it has already bought the FCC and those folks are just their btches. It would be priceless if the regulators cut AMZN off at the knees, especially since AMZN is hyping the new antenna which hasn't been tested... As for the products themselves, the hype is so overdone. AMZN doesn't begin to compare to Apple for music and a tablet is a massively inferior format for music. Apple already has an ecosystem of millions of iOS docking speakers for iPod and iPhone devices. No one needs double Dolby digital speakers. As to video content, Apple will launch its own NFLX like service (hell, buy NFLX now that it is almost free) and has a superior cloud offering because of the larger installed base and at home sharing. Having said that, I REALLY hope Apple sues Amazon for patent infringement (admittedly, I don't know which patent, but I'd be shocked if it cannot find an instance of infringement) and seeks an injunction now that amazon has announced the intent to hurt appke's hardware business model and margins. In Google, nuclear war would have been MAD. With amazon, Apple can go directly after Amazon's core cash generator and put it under significant duress...
